sub-sections.title: Day-1
labels:
---
title: Day-01
sub-module: BDL-Intro
---
## Introduction
- The terminal

## Quick overview of paths in the linux filesystem:
- The 'pwd' command
- The '/' folder
- The home folder and `~` shortcut

## Moving around
- The `cd` command!
- Absolute paths (beginning with `/`)
- Relative paths: the `..` shortcut, navigating into sub folders
- The last directory shortcut: `cd -`

#### Material-en
- [Material en 1](https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1911KEZ_dNVd_puEcNXSaoTB7-J_6CjcSOzQ32Ej6mec/edit?usp=sharing)
- [Material en 2](https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1911KEZ_dNVd_puEcNXSaoTB7-J_6CjcSOzQ32Ej6mec/edit?usp=sharing)


##### Material-de
- [Material de 1](https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1911KEZ_dNVd_puEcNXSaoTB7-J_6CjcSOzQ32Ej6mec/edit?usp=sharing)
- [Material de 2](https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1911KEZ_dNVd_puEcNXSaoTB7-J_6CjcSOzQ32Ej6mec/edit?usp=sharing)
assigns:
### Exercises

- [Moving Around](https://github.com/DigitalCareerInstitute/BDL-navigating-movingaround)
- [Terminus Game](https://web.mit.edu/mprat/Public/web/Terminus/Web/main.html)

## Listing files and directories
- The `ls` command
- List directories and files: `ls -l`
- Showing hidden files: `ls -a` flag
- Combining flags `ls -la`

### Exercises

- [BDL Viewing and Reading Dir](https://github.com/DigitalCareerInstitute/BDL-viewing-read_dir )

## Reading files
- The 'cat' command
- The 'less' command
- The current directory shortcut: '.'

### Exercises
- [BDL Navigating & Reading Files](https://github.com/DigitalCareerInstitute/BDL-navigating-readingfiles)
